FuncDef:
The import-route command enables IS-IS to import routes from other protocols.
The undo import-route command disables IS-IS from importing routes from other protocols. The import-route command enables IS-IS to import routes from other protocols. The undo import-route command disables IS-IS from importing routes from other protocols. By default, IS-IS does not import routes from any other protocol.
CLIs: import-route { direct | static | rip [ <process-id> ] | bgp [ permit-ibgp ] } [ cost-type { external | internal } | cost <cost> | tag <tag> | { route-policy <route-policy-name> } | [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ] ]
import-route { ospf | isis } [ <process-id> ] [ cost-type { external | internal } | cost <cost> | tag <tag> | { route-policy <route-policy-name> } | [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ] ]
import-route { rip [ <process-id> ] | bgp [ permit-ibgp ] | direct } inherit-cost [ { level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 } | tag <tag> | route-policy <route-policy-name> ]
import-route { ospf | isis } [ <process-id> ] inherit-cost [ { level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 } | tag <tag> | { route-policy <route-policy-name> } ]
undo import-route { direct | static | { ospf | rip | isis } [ <process-id> ] | bgp }

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about the ABR or ASBR of an OSPF route in a specified OSPF process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295. The default value is 1.

Imports IBGP routes in a public network instance.
If you do not specify this parameter, the device imports EBGP routes only.
-

The cost type of a route.
-

Sets the cost type to IS-IS external.
-

Sets the cost type to IS-IS internal.
-

Specifies the cost for imported routes.
The value is an integer, and the value range depends on the cost type.
When the cost type of the device is wide or wide-compatible, the value ranges from 0 to 4261412864.In other cases, the value ranges from 0 to 63.
The default value is 0.
To set the cost style, use the cost-style command.

Specifies the administrative tag assigned to the imported routes.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies the name of a route-policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

Imports routes to the Level-1 routing table.
-

Imports routes to the Level-2 routing table.
-

Indicates that routes are imported into Level-1 and Level-2 routing tables.
-

Imports IS-IS routes.
Before specifying this parameter, create an IS-IS process with a process ID different from the local process ID.
-

Retains the original cost of the imported route. If this parameter is specified, you cannot configure the cost and cost type for the routes imported by IS-IS.
-

ExtraInfo: When IS-IS and other routing protocols are deployed on a network, you can use either of the following methods to allow traffic within an IS-IS domain to reach a destination outside the IS-IS domain:
